xtc.lang.cpp
Class Preprocessor

java.lang.Object
  xtc.lang.cpp.Preprocessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Stream
public class Preprocessor
extends Object
implements Stream

This class expands macros and processes header files

Version:
$Revision: 1.66 $

Nested Class Summary
protected static class Preprocessor.ConditionalSyntax
          An object containing a token and it's presence condition.
protected static class Preprocessor.Invocation
          This class recognizes a function-like macro invocation in a given configuration and reports when the invocation needs to fork.
protected static class Preprocessor.MacroContext
          A token context that contains the tokens from a macro expansion.

          The macro context of a multiply-defined macro.

          The token context for singly-defined macro.

          A token context that produces a stream of tokens from a buffer.
protected static class Preprocessor.TokenContext
          A token context class.

Field Detail

SHOW_ERRORS

public static boolean SHOW_ERRORS
Show errors.

STATISTICS

public static boolean STATISTICS
Whether to gather statistics.

stream

protected Stream stream
The stream from which the Preprocessor gets tokens and directives

expansions

protected Stack<Stream> expansions
The stack of streams. Used for expanding macro definitions and include files

queue

protected Queue<CSyntax> queue
The queue of syntactic units waiting to be polled. This is necessary because a macro expansion will produce multiple syntactic units (e.g. annotations for original directive tokens and macro expansion delimiters), but the stream interface only returns one unit at a time. This provides a buffer.

fileManager

protected HeaderFileManager fileManager
The file manager for main file and header streams

macroTable

protected MacroTable macroTable
The macro table

contextManager

protected ContextManager contextManager
The global context

evaluator

protected ConditionEvaluator evaluator
The expression evaluator

tcontexts

protected Stack<Preprocessor.TokenContext> tcontexts
The stack of macro contexts. Used to keep track of nested macro expansions.

expanding

protected int expanding
A flag indicating whether Preprocessor should preprocess tokens or not. Used to find the open-paren in funlike invocations.

isHoistingFunction

protected boolean isHoistingFunction
Whether the preprocessor is currently hoisting a function.

scan

public CSyntax scan()
This class scans the input tokens expanding macros and returns either a Yytoken, whitespace, a directive, or a conditional.

Specified by:
scan in interface Stream

The next token from the stream.

protected CSyntax hoistPasting(CSyntax left,
                               CSyntax right)
Hoist conditionals around token-paste operation.

Parameters:
left - A regular or compound token for the left-hand-side of the token-paste operation.
right - A regular or compound token for the right-hand-side of the token-paste operation.
Returns:
the pasted token or null if the paste was invalid.

evaluateDirective

protected void evaluateDirective(CSyntax.Directive directive)
Evaluate the directive. The directives are dispatched to handler functions per type of directive.

Parameters:
directive - The directive to evaluate.

ifDirective

protected void ifDirective(List<CSyntax> list,
                           int s)
Process if directive. This takes the list of syntactic units and the position of the first syntax after the directive name. It passes the conditional expression to a function that evaluates the expression.

Parameters:
list - The tokens of the directive.
s - The number of tokens after the directive name.

tokens - The tokens of the expression to evaluate.

                               List<LinkedList<CSyntax.Token>> tokenlists,
                               List<ContextManager.Context> contexts)
Complete an expression that contains syntax-breaking conditionals. The hoisted expressions are put in tokenlists and their presence conditions in contexts.

Parameters:
list - The list of tokens of the expression.
tokenlists - The hoisted expressions.
contexts - The hoisted expressions' presence conditions.

includeDirective

protected void includeDirective(List<CSyntax> list,
                                int s,
                                boolean includeNext)
Process include directive. This takes the list of syntactic units and the position of the first syntax after the directive name. Computed macros are evaluated. If the macro is multiply-defined, we generate multiple includes that are wrapped in conditional objects. The preprocessor needs

Parameters:
list - The tokens of the directive.
s - The number of tokens after the directive name.
includeNext - Whether the include directive was an #include_next directive.

defineDirective

protected void defineDirective(List<CSyntax> list,
                               int s)
Process define directive. This takes the list of syntactic units and the position of the first syntax after the directive name. This function parses the macro, determining whether its function- or object-like and adds a new table entry given the current context.

Parameters:
list - The tokens of the directive.
s - The number of tokens after the directive name.

token

protected void token(CSyntax.Token token)
Check a token to see if it's a defined macro and expand if necessary. Multiply-defined macros are expanded to all definitions, but wrapped with conditionals. The Preprocessor must check for conditional objects to update the context and also to normalize token-pasting and stringification that involve conditionals

Parameters:
token - The token to try to expand.

hoistFunction

protected void hoistFunction(CSyntax.Token token)
Parse a function-like macro invocation and hoist conditionals around it if necessary. This function pulls the tokens of the invocation directly from the preprocessor's token-stream via the scan() function.

Parameters:
token - The token containing the macro name.

forkInvocation

protected static List<Preprocessor.Invocation> forkInvocation(Preprocessor.Invocation inv,
                                                              ContextManager.Context context,
                                                              List<Preprocessor.ConditionalSyntax> list)
Fork a function-like macro invocation.

Parameters:
inv - the current invocation.
context - The presence condition of the invocation.
list - The tokens of the invocations so far.
Returns:
the resulting forked invocations.

funlikeInvocation

protected Preprocessor.MacroContext funlikeInvocation(CSyntax token,
                                                      List<MacroTable.Entry> entries)
Expand a function-like macro invocation. This method assumes that any conditionals that break the invocation have already been expanded by hoistFunction. This parses the parameters, expands them, and replaces the formal parameters with the actuals in the macro definition. This method follows the gcc preprocessor implementation. The pseudo-code for this algorithm is the following:
 if (funlike)
  fun funlike_invocation_p
    check for paren
    fun collect_args
      for each argument
        call cpp_get_token
        while tracking parens and commas
          commas must be nesting == 0
          don't forget to capture variadics!

  fun replace_args
    loop through tokens in func macro def
      if we encounter an arg
        stringify the arg
        expand the arg
          fun expand_arg
            call push_ptoken_context of the args tokens
            call cpp_get_token
              buffer resulting tokens and store for arg replacement
            call _cpp_pop_context
    now we replace the args in the func macro def, loop through
      replace expanded, stringified, and do pasting
      swallow the comma on variadic arg

 call _cpp_push_token_context of the macro's definition (w/args replaced)

Parameters:
token - The macro name token.
entries - The definitions of the macro from the macro table.
Returns:
a new token context containing the macro expansion.

replaceArgs

protected Preprocessor.MacroContext replaceArgs(String name,
                                                LinkedList<LinkedList<CSyntax>> args,
                                                LinkedList<LinkedList<CSyntax>> rawargs,
                                                List<MacroTable.Entry> entries,
                                                LinkedList<CSyntax> buffer)
Substitute the formal parameters in a macro definition with the actual parameters from the macro invocation.

Parameters:
name - The name of the function-like macro.
args - The actual parameters.
rawargs - The actual parameters including commas and whitespace.
entries - The macro definitions from the macro symbol table.
buffer - The raw tokens of the macro invocation.

trimInfeasible

protected static void trimInfeasible(List<? extends CSyntax> list,
                                     ContextManager.Context context)
Trim tokens whose presence condition is infeasible under a given presence condition. The passed list of tokens is modified.

Parameters:
list - The list of tokens.
context - The presence condition to test for feasibility under.

stringifyArg

protected List<CSyntax> stringifyArg(List<CSyntax> arg,
                                     ContextManager.Context global)
Stringify a macro argument. Because of conditionals, there may a different stringified argument by presence condition. This method hoists the conditional around stringification and returns a list of string literals.

Parameters:
arg - The list of tokens of the macro argument.
global - The current presence condition. Used to trim infeasible tokens
Returns:
The list of string literals.

buildBlocks

protected static List<CSyntax> buildBlocks(List<CSyntax> list,
                                           ContextManager.Context global)
Take a list of tokens and conditionals and group the conditionals together into a structured conditional block object.

Parameters:
list - The tokens to build the conditional blocks from.
global - The current presence condition, used to trim infeasible conditional branches.

buildConditionalBlock

protected static CSyntax.ConditionalBlock buildConditionalBlock(CSyntax.If start,
                                                                Stream streamin,
                                                                ContextManager.Context global)
Build one conditional block out of a list of tokens.

Parameters:
start - The starting "if" compound token of the conditional.
streamin - The remaining tokens of the conditional.
global - The current presence conditional used to trim infeasible conditional branches.
Returns:
The conditional block.

escapeString

protected static String escapeString(String str)
Escape quotes in the string and add quotes.

Parameters:
str - The string to escape.
Returns:
The escaped string.

hoistStringification

protected static void hoistStringification(List<? extends CSyntax> list,
                                           List<StringBuilder> strings,
                                           List<ContextManager.Context> contexts,
                                           ContextManager.Context global)
Hoist stringification around all conditionals in a list of tokens. This completes the conditionals by taking all combinations of their branches, resulting in multiplicative explosion in the number of strings.

Parameters:
list - The list of tokens containing conditionals to hoist.
strings - The stringified strings.
contexts - The presence conditions of the hoisted conditionals around each string.

expandArg

protected LinkedList<CSyntax> expandArg(LinkedList<CSyntax> arg)
Expand an argument by pushing a token context and using Preprocessor.

Parameters:
arg - The argument to expand.
Returns:
The expanded argument.

expansionOff

protected void expansionOff()
Turn expansion off. The preprocessor will not preprocess any tokens in this state.

expansionOn

protected void expansionOn()
Turn expansion on. The preprocessor will preprocess tokens in this state.

isExpanding

protected boolean isExpanding()
Check if preprocessor should preprocess tokens or not.

Returns:
true if the preprocessor should be expanding macros.

pushTokenContext

protected void pushTokenContext(Preprocessor.TokenContext tcontext)
Push a token context. A token context is a list of tokens that are pending preprocessing. They are used for preprocessing macro definitions after expansion. Since macros can be nested, the token contexts are stored in a stack.

Parameters:
tcontext - The token context.

popTokenContext

protected CSyntax popTokenContext()
Pop a token context. Returns a macro expansion delimiter.

Returns:
A delimiter that signifies the end of a macro expansion.
